page.title: 12SCOTS PHRASES INNERLEITHEN
page.content: {1Mind yer play piece the morn's morn. Remember your elevenses tomorrow. {He had a muckle skelf in his pinkie. He had a big splinter in his finger. {Sit intae the fire.}Sit near the fire. {He's in fine fettle}He's in good form. {I'm fair vext for that glaikit laddie I'm very sorry for that dopy boy. {The twae lasses had a grand blether. The two girls had a long chat. {I took a richt scunner at the slitter. I was disgusted by the mess. {Willye go the messages for a half loaf Will you shop for bread? {Dinnae dicht the glaur wi yer peenie. Don't wipe the mud with your apron. {Oot o' the burn came a drookit laddie Out of the stream came a very wet boy. {Dinnae coup the brambles ye gowk. Don't spill the blackberries you fool. {Rin like stoor up the Kirk brae. Run your fastest up the hill to Church
